Under BSF, every secondary school in England was due to be rebuilt or refurbished over a 15-20-year period at an estimated cost of Â£ 55 billion. Michael Gove said the programme had been beset by massive overspends, tragic delays, botched construction projects and needless bureaucracy. The decision is a further embarrassment for the Education Secretary who was forced to apologise last summer after he released a flawed list of school building projects facing the axe.
